alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Chaves County Plains; De Baca County; East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Eastern Lincoln County; Eastern San Miguel County; Espanola Valley; Estancia Valley; Far Northeast Highlands; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Guadalupe County; Harding County; Jemez Mountains; Lower Rio Grande Valley; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Northeast Highlands; Northwest Highlands; Quay County; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Santa Fe Metro Area; South Central Highlands; South Central Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southwest Mountains; Upper Tularosa Valley; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 2:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG MICROBURSTS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF LOS ALAMOS, SAN MIGUEL, NORTHWESTERN HARDING, EASTERN SANDOVAL, SANTA FE, SOUTHERN MORA, SOCORRO, GUADALUPE, BERNALILLO, TORRANCE, LINCOLN, DE BACA, NORTH CENTRAL CHAVES, SOUTHWESTERN QUAY, VALENCIA AND SOUTHEASTERN RIO ARRIBA COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM MDT... At 230 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking virga showers and a couple of dry thunderstorms along a line extending from 17 miles northeast of Monticello to 7 miles south of Watrous. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albuquerque, Rio Rancho, Valencia, Santa Fe, Lincoln, Los Alamos, Los Lunas, Las Vegas, Espanola and Socorro. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 135 and 341. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 104 and 391. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 137 and 290. Highway 550 between Mile Markers 1 and 39. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 103 and 336. Highway 380 between Mile Markers 1 and 104. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 1 and 105. State Road 63 between Mile Markers 0 and 25. State Road 65 between Mile Markers 1 and 14. State Road 94 between Mile Markers 1 and 18. State Road 105 between Mile Markers 0 and 9. State Road 266 between Mile Markers 0 and 6. State Road 276 between Mile Markers 0 and 5. State Road 283 between Mile Markers 1 and 12, and near Mile Marker 14. State Road 434 near Mile Marker 0. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 1 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.
